summary: Mobile school application for PKM Public School, Semli focused on Education, Discipline, and Sports, serving students, parents, and teachers with a clean, professional, mobile-friendly UI and secure dashboards.
architectural_notes: Support multiple user roles (student/parent/teacher) behind secure authentication and role-appropriate dashboards.

existing_features.title: Create a cohesive, modern, mobile-first visual theme for PKM Public School, Semli that feels clean, professional, and inspiring for students, parents, and teachers, and reflects the values Education, Discipline, and Sports. Use consistent colors, typography, spacing, and component styling across all screens (avoid a blue/purple-dominant palette).

Implement the Home screen with: (1) PKM Public School logo and name, (2) a welcome message highlighting Education, Discipline & Sports, and (3) quick access buttons for Academics (Education), Discipline, Sports, and Notices.
Add app-wide navigation suitable for mobile (e.g., bottom navigation or a simple menu) to access Home, Education, Discipline, Sports, Notices, and Dashboard.

Build the Education section UI with subpages for: class-wise study materials, homework & assignments, exam schedules & results, and teacher announcements. Provide list + detail views for each content type, filtered by class where applicable.
Build the Discipline section UI with subpages for: school rules & code of conduct, attendance tracking, student behavior updates (parent-facing), and important guidelines/policies.

Build the Sports section UI with subpages for: sports activities & facilities, upcoming tournaments & events, achievements & awards gallery, and fitness/training schedules. Include an image gallery view for achievements/awards.
Build the Notices & Announcements section with subpages for school circulars, holiday list, and event updates, each with list and detail views and basic sorting by date (newest first).

Implement secure login using Internet Identity and add a Parent & Student Dashboard that shows: student profile, performance overview (e.g., recent exam results/summary), and a notifications/alerts feed.
Wire the frontend to the backend using React Query for all section data (lists/details), with loading states, empty states, and error states for each screen.

Add the required generated static images to the frontend as assets and render them in the UI where appropriate (logo on Home; gallery placeholders in Achievements/Awards). Store generated images under frontend/public/assets/generated.
Replace the current school logo asset with a new logo and ensure it is served as a static asset under frontend/public/assets/generated.
Update all UI locations that render the school logo to use the updated logo asset (including the sticky header branding and the Home screen hero logo).

Create a new square, cleanly-cropped school logo image from the user-uploaded photos (IMG_20260208_024007233.jpg and IMG_20260208_024007233-1.jpg) and add it as a static asset under frontend/public/assets/generated.

Update the centralized branding configuration to use the new logo asset path, and ensure all logo render locations (at minimum: sticky header branding and Home screen hero) display the new logo via the branding constant.

new_feature_requests.summary: Home screen with school logo/name, welcome message (Education/Discipline/Sports), and quick access buttons (Academics, Discipline, Sports, Notices)
Education section: class-wise study materials, homework/assignments, exam schedules/results, and teacher announcements
Discipline section: rules/code of conduct, attendance tracking, student behavior updates for parents, and guidelines/policies
Sports section: activities/facilities info, upcoming tournaments/events, achievements/awards gallery, and fitness/training schedules
Notices & announcements: school circulars, holiday list, and event updates
Parent & student dashboard with secure login, student profile/performance overview, and notifications/alerts
App-wide design system: school-themed colors, simple navigation, mobile-friendly layout, professional yet student-friendly UI

Implement backend data models and canister methods to store and retrieve all core content types: study materials (class-wise), homework/assignments, exam schedules, exam results, teacher announcements, rules/code of conduct, attendance records, behavior updates, guidelines/policies, sports activities/facilities info, sports events/tournaments, achievements/awards (including image URLs/paths), fitness/training schedules, circulars, holidays, and event updates.

Add role-aware access control in the backend for teacher/admin-managed content and student-specific data (attendance, behavior updates, performance). Use the authenticated principal (Internet Identity) to identify users and restrict student-specific views to authorized principals.
Update/replace the app logo asset (school emblem/crest) across the UI (e.g., Home screen header/app branding)
